messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] egg substitutes Julie
messages.msgSnippet: Have to jump  in on this one here, apples tear my sons bottom up! it not only turns red but splits open into tiny sores almost as soon as he eats apple, drinks
messages.messageBody:
Have to jump in on this one here, apples tear my sons bottom up! it not
only turns red but splits open into tiny sores almost as soon as he eats
apple, drinks apple juice, and any newton cookies or nutragrain bars all
have apple in them!

Tanya


>Hi Julie,
> Trying to figure out a rash( I'm guessing thats what
>a target bottom means) can be a process. My suggestion
>would be take your son off all foods that typically
>cause allergic reactions, then reintroduce them one at
>a time with say 3 or 4 days in between and monitor his
>bottom. Citrus, tomatoes, corn, dairy, can all be
>culprits. good luck!
>Jill
>
> I am not sure what triggers him
>> into a really gassy
>> reaction, not to mention fussy, and target bottoms.
>> Any suggestions how I
>> figure this one out?
>>
>> Happy Mothering,
>> Julie
>> Mommy to Ali and Matthew, Wife to a Great Man, Adam
>> Please check out a few of my favorite sites:
>> http://www.mothering.com
>> http://www.AttachmentParenting.org
>> http://www.LaLecheLeague.org
>> http://www.naturalchild.org
>> "It helps me to remember that people are more
>> important than ideas and that
>> being kind is more important than being right."
>> -Peggy O'Mara, Publisher of Mothering Magazine.
>>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] egg substitutes Julie
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Julie, Trying to figure out a rash( I m guessing thats what a target bottom means) can be a process. My suggestion would be take your son off all foods that
messages.messageBody:
Hi Julie,
Trying to figure out a rash( I'm guessing thats what
a target bottom means) can be a process. My suggestion
would be take your son off all foods that typically
cause allergic reactions, then reintroduce them one at
a time with say 3 or 4 days in between and monitor his
bottom. Citrus, tomatoes, corn, dairy, can all be
culprits. good luck!
Jill

I am not sure what triggers him
> into a really gassy
> reaction, not to mention fussy, and target bottoms.
> Any suggestions how I
> figure this one out?
>
> Happy Mothering,
> Julie
> Mommy to Ali and Matthew, Wife to a Great Man, Adam
> Please check out a few of my favorite sites:
> http://www.mothering.com
> http://www.AttachmentParenting.org
> http://www.LaLecheLeague.org
> http://www.naturalchild.org
> "It helps me to remember that people are more
> important than ideas and that
> being kind is more important than being right."
> -Peggy O'Mara, Publisher of Mothering Magazine.
>
